newsitem.title: CANADA: Bombardier agrees to buy Innotech unit.
newsitem.headline: Bombardier agrees to buy Innotech unit.

text.p: Bombardier Inc said on Monday that it agreed to acquire the business jet aircraft completion division of Innotech Aviation Inc.
Innotech is a unit of IMP International Inc based in Halifax, Nova Scotia. The price of the transaction, which is expected to close at the end of November, was not disclosed.

The Innotech division will continue with its completions of the Canadair Challenger 604 business jet and will specialize in interior completions of the Bombardier Global Express business jet, Bombardier said.
Global Express aircraft will begin arriving for completion in late 1997 and customer deliveries with completed interiors will begin in the first half of 1998, Bombardier said.
Innotech's aircraft completion division employs 270 people. Bombardier said it expects to create an additional 300 jobs over the next three years.
